learning_outcomes.description: Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Identify and apply basic skills in community work to influence and implement social policy through community consultation processes.

Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Identify and apply basic skills in working with groups and communities, including practice skills for engaging, assessment and intervention with communities.
Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Understand and use community education processes.
Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Understand how social work values apply to group and community work practice as methods of professional social work practice.
Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Articulate theoretical frameworks for group and community work practice in professional social work practice.

Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Recognise different forms of community, especially those based on location and those based on cultural identity, and the implications of these differences for promoting inclusive communities.
Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Understand how to contribute to culturally responsive approaches to working with groups and communities.

Use skills in engaging groups in communities - Apply research skills to access key data sources which illuminate community need and capacity for the development of effective community consultation submissions.

assessments.due_date:
22/8/2025 - 12/9/2025

Part 1: The Group Skills Workshops commence in Week 4 and continue until Week 7.

26/09/2025 1:00 pm

Part 2: The Individual Reflection is due in Week 9 on Friday.
assessments.task_description:
This description is a brief summary of the assessment task. For full details, including the marking rubric, please refer to the course Learn UQ (Blackboard) site.

The assessment consists of two parts, each worth 25% of your final grade for this assessment.

Part 1: Group Workshop

Weighting: 25% 

Description:

In the tutorials from Week 4 (22 August) to Week 7 (12 September), students will work in groups (4 students) to facilitate one of four community work practice skills workshops. The aim of this group task is to demonstrate the ability to define, analyse and apply direct practice skills in group work and community work. 

Group Allocations: We will be organising group membership, topics and the presentation schedule in our first tutorial. Please ensure that you attend this class. If you are unable to attend, you will be placed in a group and provided the contact details of your group members. It is your responsibility to make contact with your group as soon as possible following receipt of those details.

Tutorial Participation Requirement: If a student is unable to attend and participate in the Week 4 - Week 7 tutorials due to illness or an unexpected personal crisis, they will be required to complete a catch-up group work activity (e.g. facilitating a group activity in a tutorial). This ensures that all students meet the learning outcomes required by Australian Association of Social Workers (AASW) accreditation standards.

Part 2: Individual Reflection

Weighting: 25%

Description:

Students will undertake a reflective analysis to deepen their understanding of community work practice. For this task, students will write an (individual) reflection where they critically analyse and apply the principles of community education/problem-posing drawing on their experience of facilitating the group workshop and the experience of participating as a group member in at least one other group workshop. To support their individual reflection, students will have the opportunity in the tutorials to journal their learning experiences following each of the group workshops. These reflective journal entries will support this Part 2 of the assessment. 

Use of AI: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. While students may use AI technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI tools. Please complete the reflective statement on how AI was used in this assessment taking into account ethical considerations.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment requires students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. The electronic version of your assignment will be submitted via Blackboard, using the Turnitin software.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This description is a brief summary of the task. For full details, including the marking rubric, please refer to the course Learn UQ (Blackboard) site.

Description:

The aim of the Community Development Project is for students to demonstrate a capacity to design a community project that addresses community need and builds capacity underpinned by community development principles and skills. The project will also meet the course learning objective to demonstrate culturally responsive practice approaches to working with groups and communities. 

Students will have the opportunity to design a community development project in the form of a funding application. The funding proposal is to be completed on a pre-formatted document. 

Use of AI: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. While students may use AI technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI tools. Please complete the Student Reflective Statement on the Appropriate use of AI cover sheet for this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment requires students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. The electronic version of your assignment will be submitted via Blackboard, using the Turnitin software.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Overview and Introduction to the course

In this introductory session, we explore group work and community development as methods of social work practice. We examine community as the focus and context of social work practice. Through the course overview, you'll gain an understanding of the course structure, expectations and requirements which will enable you to engage meaningfully with the learning over the next 13 weeks.

There are no tutorials this week.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Overview and Introduction to the course In this introductory session, we explore group work and community development as methods of social work practice. We examine community as the focus and context of social work practice. Through the course overview, you'll gain an understanding of the course structure, expectations and requirements which will enable you to engage meaningfully with the learning over the next 13 weeks. There are no tutorials this week.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Education

Today we focus on the theory and practice of community education. This class will provide the foundation for planning and facilitating your group workshops in Weeks 4-7 of the course.

Learning outcomes: L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Education Today we focus on the theory and practice of community education. This class will provide the foundation for planning and facilitating your group workshops in Weeks 4-7 of the course.

learning_activities.topic:
Introductory Tutorial

In this first tutorial, we introduce ourselves and set group agreements. We organise the groups for the workshops and begin to consider community work practice skills.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Introductory Tutorial In this first tutorial, we introduce ourselves and set group agreements. We organise the groups for the workshops and begin to consider community work practice skills.

learning_activities.topic:
Culturally Responsive Community Work

Today we host a guest practitioner who will guide our learning about protocol for respectful engagement with culturally diverse communities.

Learning outcomes: L02, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Culturally Responsive Community Work Today we host a guest practitioner who will guide our learning about protocol for respectful engagement with culturally diverse communities.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Education

We review community education principles and identify important skills for the group workshops. We will discuss approaches to, and skills in, engaging with culturally diverse communities.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L05, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Education We review community education principles and identify important skills for the group workshops. We will discuss approaches to, and skills in, engaging with culturally diverse communities.

learning_activities.topic:
Working with Groups in a Community Context

We discuss the types of groups in a community work context. We explore the different ways community workers facilitate group participation. This theme will continue in the tutorial.

Learning outcomes: L02, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Working with Groups in a Community Context
learning_activities.topic_description: Working with Groups in a Community Context We discuss the types of groups in a community work context. We explore the different ways community workers facilitate group participation. This theme will continue in the tutorial.

learning_activities.topic:
Maximising Group Participation

This tutorial begins with the first skills workshop which focuses on achieving inclusive group leadership through maximising participation in groups. Following the workshop we discuss material from the course readings with a focus on the stage theory of groups.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Maximising Group Participation This tutorial begins with the first skills workshop which focuses on achieving inclusive group leadership through maximising participation in groups. Following the workshop we discuss material from the course readings with a focus on the stage theory of groups.

learning_activities.topic:
Groups as Vehicles for Change

We return to the theme of working with groups and consider some practical examples of how community groups are being used to achieve change.

Learning outcomes: L02, L04, L05, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Groups as Vehicles for Change We return to the theme of working with groups and consider some practical examples of how community groups are being used to achieve change.

learning_activities.topic:
Managing Conflict in Groups

The second student skills workshop addresses the topic of understanding and managing conflict in groups. We discuss conflict as an inevitable part of groups and consider how conflict can be managed constructively.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Managing Conflict in Groups The second student skills workshop addresses the topic of understanding and managing conflict in groups. We discuss conflict as an inevitable part of groups and consider how conflict can be managed constructively.

learning_activities.topic:
Asset Based Community Development

We explore the principles of an Asset Based Approach to Community Development.

Learning outcomes: L02, L04, L05, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Asset Based Community Development We explore the principles of an Asset Based Approach to Community Development.

learning_activities.topic:
Assessing Community Needs & Capacities

Assessing a community's needs and capacities is the topic of the group workshop. We will discuss the Asset-Based Community Development (ABCD) approach.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Assessing Community Needs & Capacities Assessing a community's needs and capacities is the topic of the group workshop. We will discuss the Asset-Based Community Development (ABCD) approach.

learning_activities.topic:
A Critical Practice Perspective

We consider forms of community work that are aimed at creating social change.

Learning outcomes: L02, L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: A Critical Practice Perspective We consider forms of community work that are aimed at creating social change.

learning_activities.topic:
Working with the Media

The final skills workshop addresses working with the media (print or social media) to represent and advocate for your community. Students learn the skill of preparing media releases in community practice. We consider whether generative AI can play a role.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Working with the Media The final skills workshop addresses working with the media (print or social media) to represent and advocate for your community. Students learn the skill of preparing media releases in community practice. We consider whether generative AI can play a role.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Consultation and Advocacy

We explore community consultation processes from a practice perspective and introduce the role of an advocacy paper. We will discuss how to write an advocacy paper based on community consultation processes. We explore the social worker's role in representing and advocating for/with communities through community consultation processes.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Consultation and Advocacy We explore community consultation processes from a practice perspective and introduce the role of an advocacy paper. We will discuss how to write an advocacy paper based on community consultation processes. We explore the social worker's role in representing and advocating for/with communities through community consultation processes.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Consultation Processes

In this tutorial, we explore community consultation processes and discuss the role of an advocacy paper as a means to represent community.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Consultation Processes In this tutorial, we explore community consultation processes and discuss the role of an advocacy paper as a means to represent community.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Work Practice & Policy Processes

We continue to explore community consultation processes from a practice perspective. We focus on the social work role and writing an advocacy paper.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Work Practice & Policy Processes We continue to explore community consultation processes from a practice perspective. We focus on the social work role and writing an advocacy paper.

learning_activities.topic:
Community Consultation Processes

In this tutorial, we continue to explore community consultation processes and begin to discuss and plan your community development project.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L06, L07, L08
learning_activities.topic_description: Community Consultation Processes In this tutorial, we continue to explore community consultation processes and begin to discuss and plan your community development project.

learning_activities.topic:
Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 1

We consider how social workers in community practice access funds for community activities. We discuss the following elements of your funding submission for your community development project: writing a budget, timeline and milestones.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 1 We consider how social workers in community practice access funds for community activities. We discuss the following elements of your funding submission for your community development project: writing a budget, timeline and milestones.

learning_activities.topic:
Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 1

In this tutorial we focus on the skills involved in writing a funding submission. The class will engage in writing exercises.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 1 In this tutorial we focus on the skills involved in writing a funding submission. The class will engage in writing exercises.

learning_activities.topic:
Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 2

Preparing your Funding proposal. We continue to focus on the funding submission for your community development project and consider all the components. We discuss the community development principles and values underpinning your project design.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 2 Preparing your Funding proposal. We continue to focus on the funding submission for your community development project and consider all the components. We discuss the community development principles and values underpinning your project design.

learning_activities.topic:
Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 2

In this tutorial we continue to focus on the skills involved in writing your funding submission. We will reflect on the community development principles and skills that underpin your project design.

Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Preparing your Funding Proposal Part 2 In this tutorial we continue to focus on the skills involved in writing your funding submission. We will reflect on the community development principles and skills that underpin your project design.

learning_activities.topic:
Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 1

Today we will continue to discuss the funding proposal and focus on project evaluation processes.

Learning outcomes: L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 1 Today we will continue to discuss the funding proposal and focus on project evaluation processes.

learning_activities.topic:
Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 1

In this tutorial we explore project evaluation processes.

Learning outcomes: L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 1 In this tutorial we explore project evaluation processes.

learning_activities.topic:
Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 2

In the final lecture, we conclude our discussions of the funding submission and evaluation processes. Key course themes will be reviewed.

Learning outcomes: L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Implementation, Evaluation and Review Part 2 In the final lecture, we conclude our discussions of the funding submission and evaluation processes. Key course themes will be reviewed.

learning_activities.topic:
Course Review

In the first half of the tutorial we review your learning in the course. In the last half we celebrate your achievements over the semester - activity to be decided together!

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08
